content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												I actually bought the game back in the day, stumbling upon it during a massive sale. At the time, I wasn't particularly impressed, as it lacked a lot of the freedom of your typical city-builder, and the progress seemed slow enough that I wondered if I'd ever see my town grow into a city before losing interest in the game.In retrospect, I think I had largely missed the point. As it has gone free-to-play, firstly, I'm glad it avoided the pittfalls of becoming a pay-to-win game in the process, as the two more often than not go hand-in-hand. My town is still small and undeveloped, and as more of a city-builder myself, I have yet to really go deep into the siege/warfare aspects of the game. The controls for that, in what little of it I have engaged in, were a little clunky and troops were difficult to manage, but it seemed that it was surmountable, and that with time and experience, one could probably master the warfare system, should they be inclined to do so.As a city-builder, which is where I'm coming from, it is a bit limited, as you don't really choose where buildings go as freely as you do in most others. That said. it has been fun seeing my town grow, and stocking it with a large enough garrison to defend myself against any potential attackers. In fact, the game is probably more comparable to an online game I used to play called Travian, but it is very polished graphically in comparison, and much deeper in terms of variability and different units/buildings.The slow pace of the game might deter some, but I've come to enjoy stopping by every so often to see how many resources my villagers have accumulated. I check in once every other night or so, and in that span they've usually cobbled together enough stuff for me to be able to signifiantly add to my town with each log in.All-in-all, it's not a game for everyone, and it limits the freedom of both the city-builder and the strategy/siege models, however in return it provides both of those in one game, doing something unique and playable, to me anyway. There's a lot in here for one game, and not necessarily too much, as is so often the case these days.The price is right, these days, so it's certainly worth giving a shot, and remember to log in a few times before giving up on it, if you're not enjoying it so much. It wasn't until my fifth login or so that I started realizing that I was actually having fun with the game. Be that a critique or not, I recommend the game as it currently stands.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												What I liked the most in the game is the capacity of building your town/city as your style, the management of your armies and economy it's also very good. The politics are very simple and so the mechanics of the game, such as: trade, hiring mercenaries, heal units. I believe that what can get players confused or a bit annoyed it's the camp, on the Online mode you only receive the bonus from the camp if you're online. On the offline mode, the single player it's more simple than ever, some may not like it, because you only manage your armies and you don't make your city/town grow to be powerful. You have to deal with the armies and a very small part in managemet of the city, this could improve by letting players using the building system inside the city on Single player. Now, in other words, this game is excellent to people who enjoy strategy war games, it's really amazing the system and the graphics are beautiful and easy to play during the battles. This game could improve? Yes, but it's also give us a great new experience in this new style of strategy-war-rpg-management game and also it's very fun and addicting. I truly recommend this game to anyone who enjoy being a "king" even in a fantasy world.

												If you are into games that return on your investment of planning, time, and forsight this is a great game. It truly benefits the planner, and has some fun storyline action as well. Later on while moving into higher level PvP and PvE you can find yourself having to think on the move as everyone has a new trick and generally speaking players keep strategy to themselves. Although there are a few glitches/graphical errors, the games Dev's and Mod's have done a great job fixing what we complain about, if we complain about it through the right channels. This is basically the first game ever that you can pay to improve, but it's actually not pay to win, everything can be earned in one way or another that can be bought. number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												Kingdom Wars... Something I've been looking for, for a long time. It's quick, fast paced, and full of action. Lacking in a few departments though, as outlined below (for now.. maybe they'll update.)  Remember Warcraft? Starcraft? The strategy it took? yet how short the games were?  Well this is a persistant version which will span the eons~!  This game, putting strategy to 11, and action to 12. Kingdom wars is my personal new addiction.. My girlfriend says I should stop playing it, after putting in over 60 hours in less than 5 days! The up-to-date graphics and the strategy. It's all wonderful.. Here is some things they could add to make the game much better:Add a "Formation setup" option for pre-battle, so the troops are already set up the way you want instead of some weird star, or all mashed together.. it makes it difficult to grab the troops you want.  Or just a "formation setup" in the choices on the world map for the armies. like where it says "Transfer" "Camp" "split army" etc..Have seperate tabs for troop types when they exceed the maximum "select all", or preset saved tabs for number keys, instead of having to reset them every battle. for an example.. (i don't know the max 'select all' option)  Say the max was 10 for example.. and you have 15 of said troop in your army. when you click the tab for knights, 5 would be not selected. Have a seperate tab for those extras.Auto trade routes.  for instance, setup where you can set an army on the world map to go to a certain town, trade, for gold, and return home automatically.Pre-battle map spawn choices. When you join someone in a coop battle, both players troops are all mashed together, and we spend 5-10 minutes just seperating them and setting them up. Or if we wanted to flank in opposite directions. the choice and versitility would be a nice addition.. or atleast setting us up seperately instead of all mashed together.Ability to choose which army is picked for coop battles... countless times I've been asked to coop, but it gave me one of my side armies, and not my main one.  An army moral bonus (small bonus of some kind like +3% bonus to all stats or some crap) while within a certain range of your main hero, if it's on the field.Ability to choose organise pesants in your home town... I don't know how many times I went "hmmm... how many do i have chopping wood, gold digging, getting food, etc etc.. how many are doing what?" lol. A list would be nice..Ability to organise troops by your choice, not forced choice. I personally like to organise my troops by level, but it's impossible to do your current way.Randomize the maps.. not areas, just where enemies spawn.Ability to move / rezise the chat box... it's in the way, or if it's not in the way, we can't see it.EDIT: Auto battle / map clear ability. Say you are training multiple units, you send them off to a region, and usually keep combing over the same area over and over.. set a choice to let the units clear on their own.Stretch the world map a few thousand units, and allow players to see other players towns.. this would open up player sieging by choice, not random chance.Archers target walls / doors / buildings sometimes, which can be a pain when you want them to attack the enemy archers on the walls / bridges to protect your rams.Aside from these, I'm a huge fan of the game so far.. cheers. Keep up the good work.

Posted: November 7, 2014
												Hands down one of the best games i've played in the past 5 years.  It's very addictive and captivating.  I like the 24 hour grace period that allows a new player to get used to the game and learn how to play before becoming a target for the rest of the online world.  And i like that everyone is pretty much on even ground.  You can't buy yourself in to the top like a lot of games online nowadays.  If i didnt have to work to support my family, i'm pretty sure i would focus about 80% of my time to this game, and my wife would probably divorce me.  I highly recommend this game to anyone and everyone.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												This game, as slow paced as it is, has to have been one of my more favorite RTS games. I've played plenty of Warcraft in my lifetime, but this, even with its low graphics and complicated play style, has been very fun. The co-op missions were also a great way for me and my friend to set goals in the game, since it gets harder with a friend than by yourself. With the races, humans have to be the most balanced between resource gathering and troop building, elves are easier to being able to build but harder to gather food to build an army, and orcs are the zerg of the three races with troop-making being a lot easier. I recommend this game for anyone curious to play a RTSMMO.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Interesting game... I will explain.First off I highly recommend you do the tutorial and actually take the time to read the texts. There is never to much written but there is no voice acting. But the tutorial gives you a lot of needed knowledge to get the hang of the game. Also you might want to start as humans first, the other races, elfs and orcs. have confusing build structures.Now when it comes to explaining this game I would have to say, it is stronghold kingdoms map combined with a sort of Total war style combat / with age of empires sort of peasantry. Read bellow this for a further explanation.Stronghold Kingdoms - When in the main world map you will see separate borders. Your settlement will be one of several in a sort of county, with several other faction areas in a province type area. A border separates these which makes it easy to know whose who.Total War - When it comes to units in this game, you do have large formations of units instead of single soldier running about. When you construct a unit 20 come out inside of one. So when you enter war or move your units to investigate a camp, you will have the different archers in their group, soldiers, knights, so on.Age of Empires - When it comes to building structures in this game it feels like Age of Empires. Granted you wont find yourself having the peasants build the buildings, but instead you select an available spot on the ground to construct a building. Now the peasants are used to gather materials around the town area, Gold, Wood, Stone, and food are all the average resources you need to have them gathering.--------------------------------------------------------------------Things to know when you start!- You have a 24 hr peace period, meaning other players cannot attack you until after 24 hours.- Your selection of traits and plains where you build will decide a lot of stuff. Such as if wood is plentiful (plains area) , if stone is easily accessible (In mountains) , Also lastly is wooded areas (In Forests).- Doing the quests at the beginning will advance your story line, get you free resources, and decent experience towards the game as well. They are easy and actually very fun to complete.- This is a Stronghold Kingdoms style rts. Which means buildings will start building slower and slower the more you construct. If you don't want to put much time in a breathing game you may want to steer clear.- I have done little castle work, besides in the tutorial. My reflection on it though is like a Total War style castle. You build the wall then garrison the unit squads along the walls. You also build single siege weapons to attack the walls, making it easier to maneuver or attack different sections of the walls.- I did not access the market as of yet, though I clicked on it once to view it. It did seem a bit pay to win, as you purchase crowns like on stronghold kingdoms. Then you use the crowns to get resources , fast building , though it does not seem to allow unit purchase. You can purchase dragons though... not sure how OP they are.--------------------------------------------------------------------My Impressions- Early stages of the game I am enjoying. It feels like Age of Empires as my units charge around to wreck the wicked soldiers and goblins about. Making gold and other resources depends completely on how many peasants you send to that specific resource.- The late game makes me nervous, I really cannot tell if the game has the system like Stronghold Kingdoms that sort of punishes higher lvl players for attacking lower , newer players. But I guess that will be something we see in a few days if I just get rolled by some troll.- So far I do like this game, its worth continuing to play and I hope to see the population on the game grow.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												This is a really entertainment game i literally spend the whole weekend playing it. i one of the ones who bought it before it went free to play and the truth is that i quit it for a while due the lack of content and lag on the co-ops and pvp. then last week i decide to come back and see what was new and i find my self spending 12+ hours playing it :/ .the new contents are amazing, game play still need some work,  specially the co-ops. i have seen my self helping PPL on a sage and then from no where i see they stop attacking or that im the only one doing it,  and when i ask them in the battle chat they say that they are actually already inside or waiting on me. so i guess that's a bug on the co-op that they need to work on. co-op should be helping each other trough strats to get the difficult objectives,  like those long sages.the other thing is that they should consider the fact that not everyone is willing to PvP all the time, maybe its a way for them to force ppl buy shields to have some peace while playing,  but overall its really annoying and i consider that there should be better ways like other F2P game does to get cash like skins, and customization for your armies and stuff instead of forcing ppl buying shields, that will push some players away.another thing that maybe they should work on is the AI of the armies when on battle some time i just don't know wth they doing out there lol. i need to cancel and re assign objectives all the time before they get killed.ill still give this game a 4/5 maybe when they work a little bit more on it ill give them 5 :)

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												So at first i didn't know what to think about this game. And i have to say i was suprised of how fun and addicting the game was.  The beginning was a little slow but whe you are starting to get quests and your building massive armies it's awesome. For example i had an army of 60/60 all swordsmen, archers, catapults, and battering rams. I was super confident with this army lest to say because they had seen some fights all of the swordsmen were like lvl 10. But i got a little to confident and tried to seige a orc city and man i had no chance. I like the fact that i cant just jump in and seige the hardest city and expect to win. Right now im doing my best to improve my population and expand my power. It is definently a game with plenty of replay value because you can play as three different factions the Humans, Orcs, and Elfs. Right now having a blast with this game look foward to playing everday and completing more quests and becoming the strongest. Totally recommend this game for all strategy game fans!

content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												Kingdom Wars was just another free game that i would browse past when i was searching for a new game to play, but when i saw that it had recently come out on steam i decided to take a look. As i saw the trailer for the game it had only peaked my interest more, so i downloaded the game.(best decision ever~) Once the game had finished, i booted it up with no problem and was brought to one of many dream games that i had been searching for! It had conquest in a way that other strategy games could only hope for, but the games that could achieve that level were no where near as Kingdom Wars. This game was well thought out and the graphics are perfect for this kind of game(due to huge♥♥♥♥♥armies and monsters filling your screen) runs pretty damn well on a laptop. all in all, im hooked, im in love, and i got to stick a sword in another lord's face.  Reverie World Studios i salute. (now if you excuse me there are couple of traitors that need to be decapitated and armies to repel, come Fred, we must hasten back to Black Rock.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												Kingdom Wars is a massive mltiplayer Real Time Strategy game without the concept of pay to play, and in my opinion, it's a really neat game.First, the visuals are very nice and quite smooth and give more flavour to the medieval atmosphere of the game.Second, the game is very user-friendly: When you first choose the race and location and all of the details of the city you want to manage, the game makes sure to explain every single option and give the benefits of each side chosen. Also, the game makes sure to help the player as much as it can by having an option to contact directly to the creator, and giving a well-planned tutorial line of quests and a 24 hour protection (that counts ONLY when you're online) which I personally love.Third, It's just fun! You can customize the looks of your town, build a powerful army and siege all of your opponents' citis, striking fear into their eyes! Also, the NPCs are very entertaining and the game in general gives you a great expirience while playing.My final point: The game is great, and it's free so if you have the time and will you should DEFINATLY give it a shot. You won't regreat it. (and if you will, don't worry. The community is very helpful and the developers are open for suggestions at any time, so you can help them to make the game better! :D)

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												This Game is one of a kind. You get to build your own medieval town or city whilst doing quests either in pvp, co op, or solo. You get to play as humans, orks or elf's, each have there own unique way of building cities and armies. You can recruit armies of darwfs and summon dragons to you aid.If your into big fights on a large scale with pvp or pve with 1000+ armies on each side battling for gold, crowns,  power and land, this is the game for you. Its a fun medieval game just waiting to be conquered.  It's not all about the war though, you have to use your mind and skill to build your empire. You need to upgrade the armor on your troops for better defense in battle. You can also upgrade your sheep or cows for more milk and wool to trade for any resources you may need.  You can upgrade the tools the workers use and the clothes that they wear so they work faster and it improves the quality of materials they produce.With every great army theres a great leader chose your hero, build your empire and destroy your rivals.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												This game is amazing. You run an entire kingom that you build from the ground up. While there are still bugs that you will encounter, i give this game 5/5 stars for what it is.  If you want to tactically command an army, just as a king would lead his men in to battle back in the mideval ages, this game is for you. It's a game that doesn't go too easy on you either. There is always a new challenge due to the PVP system. The trading system in this game works just as you would think too. Send trade carts, and send troops to protect them from other hostiles, risk your resources, and be rewarded for being smart.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												A game so badly balanced thats its no surprise no one plays anymoreA small newbie army can easily face four dragons 1 hydra and a wizard in the pvp range of 550 points(a  common newbie army) the elites wil be mid level at that and walk all over any other armynever seen  such bad balance or complete  lack of it as is the case hereThe sieges themselves are great fun for a short while, but  with no end  game content at all its hard to see many stopping long other than for pvp( and see above for that)Theres no alliance wars, not even race wars or any content for group play, like  a race related city to build up for race wide buffsIn other bug  newsyour as likely to lose units to bugs as the ai or pvp, even your city isnt safe just in last week at least 4 in chat have said  thier entire city was lost to bugsUnits often instant die for  no apparant reason in  both pvp and  pveThe servers casue massive out of sync issues and that isnt new, I put a lot of time into the game before it went  f2p and we were forced to use steam to play and out of sync was really common even two years agoThe game has some great ideas, the combat system is fine other than terrible balance, but the bugs and flawed pvp make the game unplayable for me most of the timeplay for a week or two for the pve side then move on to a proper gameIf game is still in this state  four years after launch its hard to see it improvng much now

												Simply Awesome game!This game brings alot  hours of fun!At the first moment i was thinking,maybe not a good choice because not the best graphic...After 10hours was addiction for me!!  :)NO Pay to win!Only decorations,some extras and starterpakets what you not make imba ;)You can choose Humans,Orcs or Elves.Got your own village,where u can build alot buildings and get walls for a better defend and let the village grow up.Units go up to lvl 20 and u can deploy skillpoints,some Units like the Hero go higher than 20!Cool units with different skills inside likeOgers,Minotauren,Dwarfes,Mages,Hydra,different Dragons and much more!!!Many upgrades.You walk with your armys on worldmap.Can look for some npcs fights,quests,pvp,siege and whats really cool you can play co op ,much more fun :)You got a PvP protection and nobody can farm you :)And when you fight,only vs the same strength!!!!Friendly helpfully moderaters there and a nice community!Sometimes small bugs but they work all time on it,and when you lost something they replace it normaly :D The fightsystem can be betterMy archers shoot at wrong targets where nobody(or maybe 1guy in a wall) is at castles.I have to give a lot of commands that they shoot to the right targets.What they can improve on Better fightmechanic.Better Ai.Maybe lil bit better graphic but is really not importent,enough fun!!!More mystical units would be awesome.More changes for the hero like weapons,a horse or other cool animals to ride,and some more skills for him.Make it possible for a ally/friend to help to defend the own castle.Make more cool different places on map to visit and fight.And some special siege where u need a third player will be cool.More cool stuff for the shop And at least at the moment for me 1-2more races to play.Thx for this nice game

content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												This game is great, in my opinion. There are pros and cons to it though, so I will list them below.THE PROS:A. NOT pay to winB. Each in-game race (Orcs, Humans, or Elves,) offers a different playstyleC. The Developers of the game seem to have put a decent amount of effort into this game, even though it is free to playD. IT IS FREE! seriously, this is important - even really poorly done games (This one isn't poorly done though) are nice if they are free - all you need is hard drive space to play - Why not at least try it if it is free?E. It offers many hours of play time.F. Updates to the game are released periodically, and they are also completely free.G. Doesn't require a super powerful PC to playOK, there are cons too thoughTHE CONSA. Not enough people play this game - I have only ever seen 200 people online at one time - not exactly MMORTS (Massive, Massive Online Real Time Strategy) more like just ORTSB. It has some bugs - they aren't game-breaking, but they are there.C. It is very difficult to actually gather enough army strength to sucessfully lay siege to an AI town - you need expensive and exotic units like dragons, Minotaurs, etc,  to do it reliably.D. Most of the playerbase seems to be either Old, experienced veteran players, who have all of the best units, all the upgrades, and essentially unlimited resources. They are all but unbeatable unless they fight themselves. Most of the rest of the players are new to the game, and don't know the most basic things about playing yet. In essence, there are very few players who fall in between these two extremes.E. If you choose to play elves, it is more difficult than Orcs and Humans to gather resources.All in all, though, this is a great game, even more so because of the fact that is it free. I would recommend it to anyone that likes Real Time Strategy games.

Posted: November 2, 2014
												Having grown up with the Stronghold series, this is a must try for anyone following in similar footsteps.There are several features that I love from Kingdom Wars that gives it that little boost:Firstly Resources are gathered when you are both on and offline which help greatly, especially when you are trying to raise funds to buy crowns.Decent F2P Model. While there are always the Cape-Crusaders who will nitpick at every F2P and say how P2W it is, even though they aren’t, KWs is a Play to Win as opposed to Pay to Win. While there are of course boosts and the ‘premium’ currency, all of this is earned in game and is rather pay for convenience.And one of the best things I have seen on here is the fantastic moderator team they have in game. There never seems to be a question too trivial for them and they are willing to go to the ends of the earth to help you or give you direct link with someone who can.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												I would like to start off by saying that I am a big RTS\RPG fan.  I am also a big fan of MMO games.  I have played this game with an open mind, as I suggest anyone else who tries this game, do without having any pre-conceived ideas or expectations.  The game mechanics are very user-friendly and easy to become accostumed to.  I have read many comments regarding the graphics.  Being an older gamer (over 40) I found myself getting a little nostalgic, which I really liked.  The game is excellent.  The concept is great.  The experience is one of the best I have had.  The most appealing aspect of this game, in my opinion, is that it is Free-To-Play.  Keep in mind that it is a RTS game and it will take time to do all the great stuff there is to do in this game.  So without further ado, good luck building your Kingdom and forging your Empire!

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Not a free to play - This is not a free to play game, and it is easy to see that it is not. Most games that are MMO city builders like this rely heavily on users buying boosters. This games does not. First of all, there are only three boosters in the game, and you can not use more than 1 of them per in-game account/city. The boosters that are there give you resources that are helpful to a beginner, but if you build your city up a bit, they can easily be aquired.PvP - When I first started, I was afraid of going into the PvP part of the game. I was afraid that people who have already made giant cities and huge armies could walk in and take all of my things; this is definitely not the case. They have balanced the game enough so that you can only fight people within 10% of your army strength. 10% is so little, that it makes you rely only on good tactics. It makes EVERY siege/co-op/defence really fun and actually a really good match. Also, most of the online playing is co-op, which is honestly one of the most fun parts of the game. You can raid AI cities or do quests with your friends, and it makes the gameplay really fun, without getting completely screwed over. Also, if you REALLY do not like PvP, you can buy the single player campaign for only $1.99, which is honestly a good deal for how fun this game is.Building your city - It is hard to build your city at the start, since resources are scarce. This is the point where the co-op takes place and is a big help. You can do quests with your friends and fight armies, and take all of the resources off of their cold dead bodies. This part beats every other city builder into dust. You can actually command your armies, instead of it being auto resolved for you. The game features 3 different races: humans, elves, and orcs. Each race is very balanced, and it would be a very hard decision on if you were to ask which race was the best. This lets you face other online players (or play WITH them) without worrying that their units are SOO much better than yours.Raiding cities - Later on, once you have a big and tough army, you can start raiding AI cities. There are 30 (from my knowledge) cities that you can siege and either loot or make your vassel. Looting can be helpful, and gives you a lot of resources; while vassels give you resources over time.Do not be turned away because it is an online city builder. Most of this game is co-op, instead of facing other players. You can join a clan and help each other out by sending each other resources. My in-game name is Enki, for anyone who has any more questions or wants to raid some AI with me! :)

content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												Kingdom Wars is a great game if you like city building and rts games. I have spent over 100 hours playing and love it.  The game does have bugs and crashes once in a while though.  You can use ingame money to buy pvp protection if you do not like pvp.  You may notice that the game has a cash shop and think that the things the packages gives are overpowered like 100k gold and 5 minotaurs and so on.  That amount of gold is easy to get after a day of playing and minotaurs are only good if you know how to use them.  The game is not pay to win in any way since the amount of bundles you can purchase is limited and everything you get from the bundles can be killed or looted.  I have personally destroyed people with bundle troops with some of the weakest troops in the game because they did not know how to use them.Overall a great game that I recommend.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
 Everything I want, Nothing I don't  Kingdom Wars is a melting pot of different styles of games and game elements/mechanics. I personally view it as a Stronghold Crusaders + a dash of Total War + World of Warcraft (the RTS, not the MMO) + A strong influence of the game elements/mechanics of those web browser based games where you build a base and army and attack other people, get attacked etc. etc. I'm sure someone will correct me on the abreviation for that kind of game but I cant remember right now. Now here are some  VERY IMPORTANT  distinctions from the rest of those games that I and many people have been asking and looking for but have never found with other games similar to this one. The developers built into the game features that actually prevent a P2W environment!  For example there is absolutely no 'Low Energy! Come back tomorrow... OR pay us $5-$10-$20-$50(best BS deal!) to keep playing!' because  there is no energy.  You cannot be attacked or attack players of higher or lower level (premium units? stronger opponents!) and  you cannot be attacked while offline!   Finally, thank you!  Waiting for resources to gather and/or something to finish building and feel like there's nothing more to do in town? Make an army and go fight NPC/AI on the world map for gold and then use your spoils of war to buy those resources or even new units! Oh did i mention this is a great way to level up your units at the same time? Or just log off and go live your life and come back to find the resources collected while you were offline! Yes there is 'premium' currency  but  it is  reasonably and realisticly  obtainable in-game for your time + effort for free! Quest's and NPC/AI battle's being the best way I've found persoanlly. An actually entertaining story line. A suprisingly indepth and well made system for selecting your race, skills, and city location(s).  Single player  modes including campaign, seige, and seige defence.  You do have to pay $2 to unlock each of these modes however.  Personally this is not an issue for me as I don't plan on using single player mode, however it could be very useful to try out different seige strategies and really $2-$6 for this game is a ridiculously good deal considering some of the alpha games on here that cost $15 in the  hope  that they turn out good. Predetermined building locations make your city(s) astheticly pleasing, strategically challenging and easy to build! None of that layers and layers of wall's shinanigans like every one of those crappy web-based Base Building RTSMMO's Wow those first five elements are  exactly what people have been asking for in games similar to this for years.  That is a  huge  reason I like this game. Now I can feel satisfied that I finally found a good game out there where the developers/owner(s)/publisher actually give a **** about what me, the player, wants in a game rather than how much money is on the paycheck. From the bottom of my heart,  thank you  and I hope you cotinue building the game like this while keeping the same ideals! You know what's even better? If you actually do spend money on the game, lets say you buy a dragon for your army,  they protect your investment.  While your normal units disappear forever when they die, your premium units, like the dragon you bought, only get knocked out and lose a few levels. Oh and you can't make an army of just dragons because that would be P2W plus they can still be countered and defeated by a prepared player, there's a dragon slayer i got for  free  after all. Right off the bat they are giving me a unit that counters one of the stronger units in the game! To make it even more balanced there's a unit cap, each unit takes up a certain amount of space, so you have to choose what you bring to battle wisely, a small but individually strong group of heavy hitters? Perhaps a massive amount of inexpensive foot soldiers with archers? It's all about the strategy, not who had the larger wallet. Also you wanna know something awesome the premium days you can buy in this game? You choose which days you want to use them for. How many games can you think of that actually do that for their players? Personally i don't know a single one, because money. Now for the other side of the coin, this game has flaws as all games natuarlly do. Animations are decent, but not great. Yes things still take time to build but it's not ridiculous amounts (i.e. 5-7 days). You have to pay for extra cities (gotta make money somehow so this is perfectly reasonable and fine with me). The controls can't be customized and are a bit clunky, biggest issue for me personally is the right mouse button. It controls your units  but  it also moves the camera if you have a single unit selected, very annoying esspecially when your trying to moe just your hero. plus there's is a very noticeable delay between the click and the effect (at least for me on my laptop). Then sometimes nothing happens at all. Trying to organize and manage your units is awkward and needs to be streamed lined. Especially when you have to do it quickly (Very Frustrating). Not to mention you have to indiviually select units to activate their abilites/magic/skills/powers which is very hard when they are in combat. Theres also some minor graphical errors, especially when the weather changes and in a couple of cut scene's where the character(s) slowly turns invisible and OHMYGODTHEIREYESANDMOUTH! Personally I find that last type of glitch hilarious as it's actually pretty common in a lot of games. Upgrades and improvements of any and all kind require 'premium' currency, walls for example require an especially large ammount and you have 4 different one's to build, but like i said about premium currency, it is obtainable in-game for a reasonable amout of time and effort so a somewhat moot point. Still I love this game and plan on continuing to play it for quite some time at a casual level, kill some time here and there, build this and that, do a quest here and there. This is a game that easily works with how you play games, hard-core, casual, it dosen't matter because it caters to any type of play style. I have only been playing for 9.3 hrs at the time of this writing but i can already feel that within 30-45 days, I will have an impressive city and army to boot and will be knocking down a few peoples walls! I absolutely, highly recommend this game for people looking for a RTSMMO with RPG elements that lets you play at your own pace, your own schedule, your own style, your own budget and actually rewards you if you dont want to play all-day-everyday and throw money at it. Even if you do throw money at it it still goes  far beyond  what any other game I have played or known will do for you for your investment. See you on the battle field and if you attack me, you shall feel the power and dismay of my elven arrows and Magical superiority!This review helpful in anyway? Let me know below by leaving a comment and/or give a thumbs up and/or down.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												This is an online game with the opportunity to build a castle with several armies and destroying your enemies or being destroyed.Resources in game are food, wood, stone, gold and crowns. Crowns you only get with quests or sieging AI cities or other players cities. Crowns are needed for wizards, dragons and also for building your castle and buildings. You also need crowns to upgrade buildings.You can do quests on strongholds co-op and you can do siege on a AI city in co-op. You can also attack a player in the field and find out who is better. Loosing is cruel as winner can choose units from your left over army.Building your own castle is great. Size of the castles in this game is the way it should be. This is your home and you want to protect it at all cost. Building all kinds of buildings in castle or outside it like archery and upgrading it is like your normal  command and conquer style as your armies get stronger with levelling up. Next to that you can build extra armies with wizards, dragons, humans, elves or orcs. You can choose a few types of wizards and dragons to make a good mix with elves, humans and orcs. This with limitations to dragons and wizards to an army. Sieging an other player is a tactical mind game you want to win. Defending your castle against another player is not for the faint-hearted. Next to that you have several computer AI cities on the world map. These are rated from easy to epic. The AI is not easy to beat you need all your skills and a well balanced army to defeat it. One of the things I found a bit stopping the fun is that you need to buy an alliance for 500 crowns. This to create an alliance. It should be free as it would help new players to help each other quicker now you have to hope you get let in when alliance recruiters are online if not no chance.Another thing I think is wasting to much time is the skill points. This should be automatic but maybe reason is that manual doing it gives more variety. Anyway it is a time consuming thing when you are in the middle of a battle when units level up. If something goes wrong with an army or something else you can send them an email or contact moderators in the chat channel and they will give you your lost army or other things back. This also helps them to work further on these bugs. Yes there are still some there. More information will make it easier for them to solve it.

												I have played this game for a few hours now.  It does need some work, its sluggish in areas, and it can be unforgiving.  The game has tons of potential!  I have enjoyed the time I have played.  If I knew that the game plays the way it does then I would have got it when it was Dawn of Fantasy and you had to pay for it.  Thats how much I like it right now.  If this opinion changes I will update.Ok.  I still really like this game.  I am noticing some bugs.  I have an issue when I try to start a quest on the world map it will not load correctly and I have to restart the game.  Also there seems to be some sorta disconnect between what happens on the quests and what my army is like when I get back to the world map.This game has awesome potential.  The devs. are working to make it more polished.  After a few fixes and maybe a graphical overhaul (not horrible but could really be better) this could be one of the best fantasy empire building games I have played.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2014
												Feels a lil glued up in the unit tasking, but other than that looks good in my mind and instantly had a lil bit of a Black and White feel to it. I like that units are in platoons, but a more Total war approach with unit orders in battle would be nice. I give it a personal 8/10Edit 1:So now that Ive gotten some more time in the game, I must say Ive been gladly surprised with Kingdom Wars. However, as with any game, there are problems, and Ill try my best to be the most helpful I can to new players and to the devs in ideas I have. 1. units orders: The manner in which units are ordered around the battlefield is good to a point, but seriously sucks in combat. Basically, if you arn't used to normal RTS games and using those command groups, then be prepared to be annoyed. The forming of solid lines of defense/attack are simple to the point of insanity. You either just run everything up at once, save for cavalry and archers, and hope you win or you take too long to form proper lines and risk taking huge damaged from enemy archer or crossbowmen in the process. The way to fix this in my mind would be to rip the current system and add in a more Total war type of battle system, making for a more fluid experience (Or just add in the ability to lock different formations to a hotkey, Idk)2. The economy: This games economy surprised me for the better in some areas, but I found lack luster in others. The dominate reliance on wood is good, but the ability to build houses out of stone instead of wood would make for the bigger projects and upgrades coming faster, and make the city look better if they had the textures to match. The crown system is amazing, being a resource that you gain from gold instead of a bought currency for real money, and making it essential to manage your crown total very carefully so not to leave you without that one vital upgrade. The food resource in this game also makes for fun play in that there are not just farms but also animals to use to produce and it just adds a much greater sense of life to your city.3. The combat: The full on combat of this game is the biggest complaint I have. It seems that the battles try to simulate tactics, but in the end it seems all that is needed is to have a direct line to enemy units and just be a Russian as possible (Quantity wins) I would recommend changing it up to make it so certain units like the crossbowmen would do so much damage that it basicallly one hits units. Another this is the special units. Through the quests I recieved a Dragonslayer, which in my mind, would be fairly good agaisnt Dragons. But when I sent him agianst the Dragon that spawned as part of the quest, well, lets just say the rest of my army was quickly heading that way. I believe that some of the special units should be very, very good against what they are meant to go against.This is my current review, as I discover more of the game and figure it out for myself, Ill let every one know what I think, still a 8/10.A video review will be uploaded within the next day or two, will post link with this written one.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												This game holds you from beginning to end. Unlike the vast majority of games this is not "pay to win", there are Easy methods to get all features. There are some bugs and problems that may trouble at first, but the game has a group of excellent mods ready to help him in-game chat. And if any be present, the vast majority of players tends to help newcomers. The game also has a PVP system that only allows troops are clashing with similar powers, thereby making any veteran can come and crush you. Apart from that you can easily avoid all the battles that do not want to face, just by paying small amounts of resources. Every battle even if you surrender, given protection against attacks that can be easily canceled. The only important feature of the game "Crowns" can be earned in various ways (pvp, pve, coop) plus conversion of "gold" in "Crowns" and those who have money it is possible to buy. It is also possible to join in alliances, which allow the construction of a "guild hall" which allows further increase its combat capability and obtaining resources to increase the amount of armies you can pussuir. Several special units like Dragons and Minotaurs. Curing units, siege units and many others. If you like games like age of empires online and would like a challenge this is the right game for you.And remember if you find any bugs do lose something the mods can readily help you recover what was lost, the maximum that may be you need help developers to post their Log Files in the game forum.Forum where you can find several tips that will help you grow fast and strong.I await you in the game. o /If you like or dislike my opnion rate down here. \ /===================================Esse jogo te prende do inicio ao fim.Diferente da grande maioria dos jogos este não é "pay-to-win", existem métodos faceis de se conseguir todos os recursos.Existem alguns bugs e problemas que podem incomodar no inicio, mas o jogo conta com exelente grupo de mods prontos para ajudalo, no  chat do jogo. E em caso de nenhum estar presente, a grande maioria dos jogadores tende a ajudar os novatos.O jogo também conta com um sistema de PVP que permite apenas que tropas com poderes similares se enfrentem, fazendo assim com que nenhum veterano possa vir e esmagar você.Além de que você pode facilmente evitar todas as batalhas que não quiser enfrentar, apenas pagando pequenos valores de recursos.A cada batalha mesmo que você se renda, recebe proteção contra ataques que pode ser cancelada facilmente.O unico recurso importante do jogo "Crowns" pode ser ganho de varias formas (pvp, pve, coop) além de conversao de "gold" em "Crowns" e para os que tem dinheiro é possivel comprar.Também é possivel se unir em alianças, que permitem a construção de um "guild hall" que permite aumentar ainda mais sua capacidade de combate e obtençao de recursos ao aumentar a quantidade de exercitos que você pode pussuir.Varias unidades especiais como Dragões e Minotauros. Unidades de cura, unidades de cerco e muitas outras.Se você gosta de jogos como age of empires online e gostaria de um desafio este é o jogo certo para você.E lembre-se se encontrar qualquer bug que o faça perder algo os mods prontamente poderão ajuda-lo a recuperar o que foi perdido, o maximo que talvez você precisa seja ajudar os desenvolvedores ao postar os seus Log Files no forum do jogo.Forum onde podera encontrar varias dicas que te ajudarão a crescer rapido e forte.Aguardo vocês no jogo. o/Se gostou ou não da minha opnião avalie aqui embaixo. \/

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												This game so full of bugs that i'm surprised bugs aren't flying out of my computer smacking me in the face. There nothing that isn't bugged in this game it has bugged quest that get so bad that it just breaks your whole town forcing you to delete it, and start a new. Like the first quet for the orc race which wants you to lore a orger into a spike trap after completeing it the spike trap suppose to disppaer, but it doesn't an everytime one of your workers or warriors walks over it it completely kills them everytime, and the orger respawn in your town killing you workers, and warriors everytime you reload your town. Then there pathfind bugs siege units get stuck on walls units get stuck climbing siege ladder or just stop moving for the reset of an instance if they some how survie a spike trap. Then Fire really annoying your troops will run into, and try to attack it for some reason, and even when it gone your unit still take damage when there in the area that was on fire. There some werid gather bug that just start in the most recent patch it took me 3 hours to collect 2 pieaces of wood when i had 10 workers try to cut wood. It should be 3-15 wood every sec depend on research or amount of workers. There also a bug with the ingame currency were you'll just randomly lose all of it for no reason so don't pay really cash on crowns cause you will lose them for no reason. Also you can gain crowns from PVP/PVE, but that also bugged 60% of the time your not reward with them after a match. An this is only about 1/5 of the bugs in the game there many more like treants bugged movement speed sometime they have a movement speed of 9999 they'll be so fast they just teleport across the battle field other time they have a movement speed of 2 they move so slow it takes them 3 hours to get across a map. There also a bug with the single player were it will say your cheating, and are unable to play the single player. The best bug so far is this extremely annoying bug that will just roll back your whole town to what it was when you started it when you get attack by another player, and the devs say this is a very rare which is Bull-**** cause it happen to about 15 people everyday which compared to the fact that 1000-1500 people login every day it about 1% of the population. So after 20 days 20% of the population town has been completely rolled back to the begining.  An the Devs are useless they don't fix bugs they take forever to post on the forums, hell there was one time were the devs didn't post anything on there website for 6 months striaght. People just started saying the game shutting down on there forums, and they didn't reply to any of thos post what they did do was delete thos post when they started posting on there site again. An for some reason the Devs are ban happy as it stands banning people for no reason at all. So overall don't waste your money on this game if you want to play it to see how buggy it is your self then just wait for it to go F2P/P2W.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												I love this game. Within two days I have managed to clock in about 9 hours. I like how you are able to build your city while, doing trade and going to war. I am still in Protection mode which lasts for a day. It helps teach you as you go if you don't want to do the training. You don't have to worry about leveling up. When you stop playing your time stops aswel, instead of you leaving and coming back two days later to your town totally destoryed. The graphics aren't bad at all and you even get to pick your race and which area you wish to start in.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												To be honest here the game has quite a lot of problems, mostly with the units pathfinding and overall grind to get enough resources or crowns to build important buildings or even stone walls which kinda killed it for me a little but the combat can be very interesting. When it comes to the combat it can be a real challange at first, not so much because of the pathfinding for me though, but because the AI's are able to move more units then you can to specific spots. But thats the fun about it, you can easily out take out the AI if you do things right but sometimes you can easily screw up and lose a bunch of units, which to me is fine again, forcing the player to think about how to go about it without losing every soldier they gained. Not to mention that the game dev's are constintly at work to fix many of the problems that are poping up, they are very aware of the situation that the game is in but are having trouble fixing them due to a recent failure going to NW2 which caused a few problems as mentioned in the recent updates section. Many people say that it isent working but to be honest once more I have a feeling that they just are trying to be trolls cause I have one of thee 2nd worst gaming laptops in my house and it runs very smoothly after I adjust the graphics. Lastly overall the graphics bring me back to my childhood days of gaming, like I said above this resembles Battle for Middle Earth quite alot in the way of graphics but I am by far fine with that, I never was a stickler when it came to things like that, just so long as the models arent sticks flouting around. Overall to me this has so far been a great experience and might even put a bit of money into it just to possibly get the starter pack or something mostly to support the dev's and because I feel like throwing money in their faces, lol. I may add more to this review wether bad or good over the coarse of the next few months and I am planing to deffinitly play this over thanksgiving, so things may change but my opinion of the game will never change, epecially since this is a newly made game, were anything could happen....and yes 3-4 years old is still considered new to me considering ages for other games.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												To be clear, the game is free; payment only gives you access to two one-use-only-ever chests of resources which you don't need one bit. There are also a couple DLCs, but if you look at development/patch notes you realise the vanilla game is rich and you won't want to pay for the stupid DLCs even into late game (e.g. there's a SP-only dlc - for the incompetent only). Please read on.3 races to choose from. Build your city, your army, your garrison, whatever labour forces you may want. Two very important factors that I find separate this game from those you may think this is similar to (involving MMO strategy games with building a settlement):1) You can't be attacked when offline. If you're not logged in and playing, you can't be attacked - meaning you don't need to worry or dedicate ANY time to this game. (You also have a cancellable 24hr-game-time-only battle protection for noobs, after which you'll have a great base. Additionally, battles are always between similar-strength forces).2) Your buildings can't be destroyed beyond 1% health. No conflict you will ever have will reset your city. Your buildings will be repaired over time and you'll just lose a token amount of resources, from what I understand you'll even get a few crowns (useful for upgrades or renaming units etc).I recommend, if you have any interest in a forgiving MMO RTS game with visual battles and really quite rich content, you should download and try a couple of the races. Read the descriptions to see what you'd be interested in and have a go. Just be wise on how you spend your crowns in the beginning as they're earned through quests (story line), battles, daily-gift of 1 crown if you login and trading in gold. P.S. you will want to make gold one of your primary mining operations, because if you shop around at some NPC towns/cities, you can usually buy more than 100 of any resource with 100 gold.I first tried the orcs (about 8 hrs), which I liked but I didn't do very well with.. Then I went to try the elves (now 14 hrs) and I love them. I don't get to design my city layout because we build in trees... but it's fun enough. Check out some of my woodelf screenshots.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												I find the game quite enjoyable. You manage a small village which, slowly, grows to metropolis. You have to decide on whats best for your village, paying off bandits, or deciding where to build the new blacksmith. The town is tailored to your design, be ye human, filthy orc, or hippy elf. The games graphics are pretty good considering the amount of individual units  each moving. You can see it at its best in the environmental changes, the winter was nice thing to in the game, although not for my peasants who were unable to plow the fields. Although the game does have its fair share of bugs mostly in the ai. The most notable were my peasants choosing to drop resources at my keep instead of a cart which was right next to them, and a dragon swarmed by footmen trying to attack my dragon slayer in the back stuck and not attempting to attack anything else. My least favorite thing about the game is the fact that you have pay money in order to have additional towns with a different race. It saddens me that i can't even try out another race without paying 5 $ or deleting my first town, im fine that you can buy boosters (Its not pay to win, you are matched against players with equal army strength) but atleast let me try the other races.Overall a fun free game 8.5/10

content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												I've played alot of stratigy games over the years and the one thing alot of them seem to lack is story. Kingdom Wars actually gives you a bit of background on what's going on in the world. A reason to go out and conquer.  Being the huge nerd that I am, I am part of a renaissance group who studies and reenacts historical battles in real life. I like the diversity of figthers and fighting styles. Halbreders are good against horses, sword men with shields are good against defending arrows and so on. This gives battle a bit more realism for me.  On top of that there is customization to your heros and armies and it's not rediculously expensive to do so. This is one of the few free to play games I acutally put money into customization because I know I will play it for awhile. There is a slight lack of options in the customization department but it is a young game still and I am sure that will grow. All in all I think the game is pretty great so far.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												I rarely write reviews but as a game tester for alpha, beta, and online mmos, i do gotta say this has been a very pleasent supprise. This is one of the few games that don't build hype to let players down. Theres not much pay to win, theres a great ballance with the units of the game, and all in all its a strong well crafted idea which I can very much put in 50 - 80 hours into this game. I do gotta say alot of the times rts are more like a gamble then strategy and this game is more of a gamble situation. Basically during battle the enemies have a range of aggro and thats really about it. I don't mind that as any war is a gamble of strength, luck, and some strategy and manuvering involved and this does put this very well. There is one otherthing that might be a bug is that the selection rectangle stays on the screen sometimes when you select a unit. Not a game breaker but it is a glitch they should look into. So far they have troop training as you enter cities, looting corpses with civs, and buying mercs and selling loot you get from enemies. The map is quite big and you can coop or even vs enemy players in segies and other pvp battles. I haven't got to test that part out yet, but you basically get your own map to your self to train your army anyway. Mount and blade strategy meet rts for the first time! It is defeently one of the more interesting games that i've seen and as a avid gamer, I am quite picky about what I play. I hope this helps!

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
												This is a great game, it has many casual gameplay elements taken from Rome total war, and some building elements from The Settlers (7?). Controlling your army, and leveling them up on the over world is great fun, building your city and aquiring upgrades also plays out well. The timers on building buildings don't hit as hard as I initially thought they would, with twenty minute build timers on some of the larger buildings passing by quickly as I focus on other portions of the gameI have to say, that by far, BY FAR, i enjoyed the first part of the game the most, the psuedo tutorial. Running around with my hero and a few units, clearing my lands from bandits, coming back to find a messenger had arrived, or a lord wanted me to do something was thrilling and immersive.The game looks fantastic for how many units are on the screen at once, and every battle I find myself Roleplaying as my hero, and ordering my units to take the field and feeling the loss of every man in all of my squads.  The only thing I really dislike are the crown earning systems, I find the process too slow, where PvP may net you the most crowns the fastest, that can come at the total loss of your army (save for maybe one or two units if you are lucky), which means it's back to the drawing board to re level up your units. (You can also buy your units levels at nearby towns with in game gold)You could also take your leveled army, and farm the overworld maps for crowns, but after the third run through of a map, I find myself getting tired of the same placement of units, the same patrol paths, the same spawn point. Vary up the maps a bit more, is all I ask, make the single player overworld a bit more varied for map selection, instead of relying on the same one or two exactly the same maps per section.It's a great free to play game if you are into city builders with PvP elements. Enjoy it while it lasts.

This is a game I surely look forward to playing further and maybe even spending some money on microtransactions. Keep up the good work!

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												Hi guys, Hellbound Commander here.  I think i've possibly found the best medieval strategy game that is Free to play, maybe even in general.  I was searching in the f2p tab on team and i came across this game.  I got interested and I downloaded it.  It was worth it.  Kingdom Wars is the best game i've played in a long time!  The level of depth to the game is almost unparalleled in anything I have seen.  There are so many features that I really can't fit into this review, so I want to ask you guys to download this game and start playing it so that you csn get a feel of what i mean.  The graphics are amazing, the battles and wars going on all around you add so much content to your experience that there is really no way to get bored of it.  You have the campaigns and the quests and everything that are sitting right there to become available to you as you build up your castle and venture out into the world of Mythador.  There are so many features, one of which is what the devs cleverly labeled the "Home Warfare" law which was passed by King Erian IV (I play as a human lord).  It offers you the chance to attack your neighbors and also other players to gain more resources, get some battle experience under your belt, or just simply entertain yourself.  To protect new players however, as on many other games your castle/town is not attackable by other players until you've spent 24 hours of real time on the game.  I've still got almost 18 hours left on mine.  It closely resembles the Stronghold crusader series because of its real-time combat and detail to the units, structures and features.  As you progress in the game you eventually become more attuned to your surroundings.  It is important to start with a strong workforce and a small army, as well as a desire to do the quests you are assigned.   That usually opens up doors to more quests, campaigns, and other features of the game.  There is a special currency in the game, called Crowns, which are used to buy some elite units, make castle siege defenses, upgrade buildings, etc.  You can buy these crowns with the in-game money called Coins, which are obtainable through Gold Mines, battles and quests.  You can also get coins by bringing a group or two of peasants along with you and tasking them for 'Corpse Looting'.  This enables them to loot corpses, whether they be your's or your enemy's, for materials and Coins.  Other ways to get Crowns are to do quests and win battles, for each you receive a specified number of crowns.  Crowns are essential in your ability to progress through the game as a successful player.This game, unlike most 'F2P' games out there is not a pay-to-win game.  The success of players isn't determined by how large their wallet is, but rather how much patience and perseverance they have.  If you Persevere you can eventually rise to the top and become one of the strongest players throughout Mythador.  I bid you all farewell future lords and ladies, and I wish you good fortune should you choose to join me and many others on Kingdom Wars.

												I love the game. its like all those king and queen games you want all in one. the army battles are huge, the ai does what its told....sometimes atleast. what problems the game has, which to be rather happy with is very little. is fixed within hours or within days. if you let them know whats wrong they will more than likely fix it. its fun to have a huge castle, ive been playing the good part of a few weeks/a month or two and ive barely scratched the surface. the range of units is great. each has strengths/weaknesses nothing is too overpowerd. there really is no spam this unit you win. seige weapons are innacurate but funny but do a lot of damage and whats cool is they use resources to fire. you get raided and the enemy doesnt bring enough resources then good luck him seiging. ive not been attacked yet and you get free premuim on start aswell as not being attacked for 24 ingame hours. not a day if you play or not. your villagers gather resources even when you are not there. the world map is lovingly huge. there is so much to do. you can play as much as you want. there is always something to do. its not like a game you can just leave running and visit an hour or day. you can just keep playing if you want to. it works both ways. the game is great. i hope to keep playing it as much as possible and as long as i can. the graphics are not top end but everything is shown. everything has good animations and the combat is fun. i hope they make graphics a little better but thats my opinion. its a great great game. those who like stratagy games will love this. there is three races too with there own sub factions. humans can get dwarves and mages to help which is cool and as far as i know each race has there own storyline but is on the global map. its great!! keep up the great work!a few things that could be fixed/improved upon. in my opinion and just general fixes that may or may not be noticed that could be done1: The formations and stances can be set but if you log out and rejoin some auto revert without being told otherwise.2: graphics. but thats just me3: a little bit more info on what formations do but not layed out in a basic format. e.g loose formation makes it harder to hit with arrows but does it decrease things in stats, if so by how much, not simply "It reduces this. but not say how much" 4: i would like to see a unit range decal so i know where archers/crossbow men and seige equipment can fire from and where best to place in defence.5. Cycle icons or timers on research and production. there is already a black loading icon but with some research i press the button and its either instant or is researching slowly, either way i cannot tell if its been researched or is researching. maybe grey out the button or say "researched already" e.g the mill, irrigation i researched but it still remains there showing the purchase amount but its no longer clickable, ok i know it means its worked but to others they might click it and go...well what now?6: the mouse feels like it lags when clicking things, sometimes it wont select a unit liturally right behind another unit or when you attack they will walk, maybe a toggle run button too but mainly the way the mouse feels. it seems to feel like its lagging when clicking. or you have to multiple click somethings a few times.7:the female hero after leaving the capital then returning will spawn, when it auto walks to the return way point it walks with a broken graphics, looking like its legs are were its arms are and its arms right outwards with the sword pointing outwards.keep up the good work!

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Kingdom Wars is not for everyone. It is a slow, complex game, though that's not to say it's any more complex than your average RTS. Starting the game the first time has a steep learning curve of about 7 hours. You have to learn all your normal RTS things like what buildings can go where to make what, what upgrades are available to each unit, basic economy & tactics, etc. But then there is an overworld map, quests, army management, sieges, and a tight constraint on crowns/influence, which is the reward for beating quests and winning combat and absolutely necessary not only for research but for special units, too. And consider this: there is a PvP element, which you either can bypass by paying off the attacker or engage and risk your units, and either way you can only rest safe for one hour of in-game time before you can attack/be attacked again. So you start off with 24 hours of in-game PvP protection. Just 24 game hours to prepare for PvP.PvE is all about quests and getting crowns/influence through quests and battling on the overworld (think random battles from older Final Fantasy games but you choose when & where.) One big flaw is the cumbersome quest system which makes you inch your way over the worldmap to the quest giver's city and then load the city map and then wait while your hero runs across the city to the quest giver. And turning in a quest often results in another one being available, but you have to exit the city and enter it again, walk your hero back to the quest giver and get the next quest in the chain. Most quests are repetitive, and don't directly scale in difficulty. You will often have to fight two armies, seige two cities, etc. and both often occur on the same map, but you have to, again, inch your way over the overworld map to get from point to point. Now the idea behind this is while one army is moving up to four additional armies can be deployed as well. This makes it possible to split your forces and multi-task on the world map, building an ever bigger collective army.Battles can be quick, though. I got to a point in the quests where I decided I would have my hero kill eveything solo, and that takes forever. But if you don't go Hero vs. World, seiging a castle can be quick, routing an army can be quick, it all depends on your playstyle and how much you risk your units, if you worry about looting every penny, spending every skill point asap, etc. This is the kind of game like OgreBattle where you can easily drop 80 hours and not even see a fraction of what there is to achieve in the game. This game is a place to escape reality and become absorbed in the fantasy RTS game, with the added pluses and minuses of PvP. There are so many details, potential strategies, and an ever unlocking complexity that keeps you learning well past the 30 hours I've put into this game so far. Despite the flaws, it is easy to get absorbed. Come and stay. We don't bite - much. :)

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												So Dawn of Fantasy: Kingdom Wars now just known as Kingdom Wars is a rather unique MMORTS with a persistent world and economy.So let's go over this with the good the bad and the improving.The Good:This game has one of the most ACTIVE dev/moderator communities I've ever seen. There are almost always devs or moderators with community supporting abilities online and they respond very quickly to player queries/problems/bug reports.City Management: It's really fun getting your city up and running, your economy working and it really helps build up a feeling of "This is mine!" when you log in to your city.Army building: The roster of units per race is not overly large or cumbersome but there is room for a lot of diversity and tactics. The way they go about this is fairly fun and unique. Each and every battalion levels up  not just the heroes. And as each battalion levels you can allocate points to that battalion so that it better supports your tactics which means you can have two players with say a swordsman battalion and each sword battalion can be the exact same level but be specced out in two totally different ways.This leads to a lot of fun with building YOUR ideal army rather than some all encompassing army of win that so many RTS games have.Battles: Battles in terms of PVP are done via matchmaking which means you won't generally have to worry about armies many times your strength coming down to slaughter you while the veteran player at their helm laughs at the newbie. DON'T be mistaken though because it is fully possible to have two armies of identical strength rating but with totally different power ratios.This can lead to some unforgiving learning cures where you need to figure out ideal combinations to match your strategy. Do you want quantity or quality do you want an ideal mix of both? Are you a player that can micro manage good enough to have a small crack corps of heroes over an army of regular soldiers? ALL of these options and combinations thereof are waiting for you to figure out.PVE: The PVE options to take and conquer AI cities is fun especially when you get co-op up and running and can work together with other players to take particularly difficult targets.Quest system: The quest system while nothing special allows you to earn some extra money and resources while not having to do the more challenging PVE or potentially unforgiving PvP battles.Opt Out: You can "pay off" a player that wants to attack one of your armies or your town so as not to potentially risk losing units you otherwise do not want to lose. This is a good thing as the above mentioned potentially unforgiving early PvP learning curve may cost you questing time/ability.So let's move on to the Bad:Right now you have a few severe bugs that while not game breaking for MOST can become so for the less patient or mature players amongst us. If you get easily frustrated with bugs and don't like having to report them or talk to moderators to get your lost resources/gold/whatever back then at the moment I'd recommend holding off on this game.Can be unforgiving: As stated with the battles section of "the good" this game can be VERY unforgiving when you lose a battle since this is a persistent world those losses are for good and some players might take days to rebuild from the loss of their core army. While most of the community is currently rather friendly and often willing to help new players with tips and tricks on how to get your economy up and running the early losses that players WILL suffer can sometimes be a little spirit breaking until you figure out how to create newer better armies and get a solid economy running.So lets move on to the "Needs improvement":So far the idea that the game is "pay to win" can kind of seem like a thing for new players because of the way crowns work and how slowly they come in for a new player.In truth I think the crown price of some units could afford to be lowered but this is personal preference.There are bugs that definitely need to be sorted out before this game can be a 10/10 and some of the promised features need to be implemented such as the naval options and the like before I can say this game is truly what the developers advertise.So for now at it's current stage I have to give this a 8/10 because it is not really "feature complete". There are bugs some of which can ruin an impatient/less mature player's experience. On the flip side the devs/moderators are extremely active and very willing to help people with any losses they've suffered and for such a small team (6 developers) they are fairly active in attempting to patch and bring this game up to a full 10/10.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												Kingdom wars is an Innovative kingdom builder.  I like the economic system, the more peasants you have working the fields, the more resources you get.  There are also upgrades for said peasants to make them more efficient, as well as upgrades for your military.  I like the fact that you don't need real cash to make crowns, which you get by completing missions, reaching accomplishment milestones or trading for gold in the game.  Trading is probably the fastest way to make gold in game, as you can create an army with a few horse carts and peasants to carry goods to market, plus add farm animals to the army to sell those in different cities.       Creating an army is easy enough, just need to go to the world map.  You pick the units you want in it, military, peasants, animals and send it on it's way.  The combat leaves a bit to be desired, I think the AI needs a bit of work, as I leave my force sttationary, send a unit of archers up to snipe at the enemy.  As soon as the enemy starts moving toward my army, I run them back and wait for the slaughter, as the enemy only sends in a few units without archer support.  After their melee units are dispatched, rinse and repeat on their archer units, who blindly follow into oblivion.  Send in the peasants to clean up the corpses and you get a nice bit of loot.  I also like the wide variety of units allowed in the game, the fact that you don't need to worry about using real money to buy the better units, as they cost resources and crowns and are available to everyone.     I haven't gotten to build up my castle yet, as I have been concentration on my economic upgrades, but from what I've seen, it really looks worth building a castle as soon as you can afford the crowns, stone and/or wood for it.  I haven't tried siege warfare yet either, so I really have no knowledge of it other than the turtorial I played.       Overall, I find the game a lot of fun, it's a kingdom builder that really allows you to build a kingdom.  You have diplomacy to ally yourself with npc's or other players, forming guilds/clans.  It is an awesome experience.
