content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												This game is being given my rating of a current 4/5 due to good performability. I will explain the reasons why I like and feel a recommendation to the game as well as the defects and failures in this game, let start with the failures first as most people like to read the Good n Bad in order, yeah...I don't do that.----BAD!!!#1: The Current Cash Shop Model allows you to literally buy your way to victory for only 10-20$ USD and is practicly forcing players to do this if they want to get their walls' up before the peace-timer ends. Not only that, the daily transaction limit on crowns should be removed, 30 Crowns a day is about 2 Upgrades of the lowest pool, not even remotely worth it.#2: Sieging requires a very large force or a very small for of units you could simply buy from the Cash Shop, Simply buying 5 Minotaurs grants you 280 Power for your army and is in no way fun to deal with as a single minotaur can kill 5 ogres by itself, let alone an entire 8 battalions of cavalry. My gripe on this is, you can also buy army power by making nothing but archers and catapults, buying fire arrows and siege munitions then stacking stone and sitting back and not doing anything as your archers have 700 range and infinite ammo.#3: Respawns are an issue when fighting other players and in missions, I play as Orcs personally because I like their resource system, it reminds me heavily of LoTRBFME, But as I could clearly see, if you buy a ton of goblins, get them all to level 20 and then max out their health regen and HP, they can literally die in combat and be instantly replenished, this obviously needs to be fixed, Goblins are in no way weak, Why buy a bunch of slayers when I could just mass so many goblins it causes the opposite player to lag out?#4: Marketplace, Oh god...This eats my RTS time soo much, Unlike "Age Of Empires" where you can setup an auto-transaction pool, you have to click the icons manually, I wish this game gave you the ability to say: "If a resource hits this  much, sell it into gold" or add a "Always keep this much on hand"; I hate having to manually click the sell resource button multiple times only to be rewarded with a deselection of the marketplace or barely any outcome.#5: The Pathing Engine, Oh lord, I broke this on the first day, apparently you can only have 3-4 Orcs harvesting a single deer, and I have about 40 Marauder Squads gathering food, problem is, there is only like 20 Marauders of the 200 collecting anything, the rest are rumbling and grumbling around like idiots, Its like watching turkey vultures trying to take turns pulling a carcass off a busy intersection, Everyone wants a stab at the corpse. This dissapoints me heavily and I believe the Pathing AI needs to be adjusted for better efficiency, because of this, I cannot bring my food income above 90.0.#6: The Resource System, Yay! not so bad now, but still underperforming. The amount of resources players are given per map, at an interval of every 3 days of respawn is stupid, If I build in a Desert, I expect far more stone than gold. And the worst part about this is the fact that the resources can only be optimally harvested by 2 harvesters each turning this into a "Starcraft 2 SCVs per Mineral Field Moment" Overrall, I either think the amount of resources per minute gathered from these needs to be increased, or increase the movement quality and gather rate of all harvesters, even with upgrades, they are still snails at this time.#7: The Upgrade System, Okay this is my final gripe, as it stands, you can literally train units to get certain skills and passives that make them sometimes, in wording of Goblin Hordes; Unkillable and other times just plain ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. How would you feel if someone's hero walked into your army and started 1-shotting all of your men and you couldn't even do more than 1 dmg to him while he regens 80/sec? Or if someone bought a set a Archers and got their movement speed, health regen, range, damage, and resistances maxed out? and just solo'd all your cavalry with arrows? Say...aren't archers supposed to be weak vs melee? It sure doesn't look like it to me. Another issue with this system, is not every unit can be upgraded, which bothers me, I cant increase the replenish rate of my Wargs, Yes I use wargs as outrunners to kill runners, and I can upgrade my laborers, even though they spawn at level 5. I would love to improve their movement speed. I realize this game is not done yet, but seriously?------GOOD STUFF!!!------#1: Performance = The game performs very well on my crappy computer, I have everything that is below the minimal requirements listed for downloading the game, my Graphics card is even out of date by 8 years. I'm suprised I can run the game at 60-113fps in terrain that would normally eat my computer, however there is one terrain that drops me below 30fps, and that is the swamps, that terrain is either high on particles or overrun with reflections. The graphics options are lack luster and need to be evaluated, but if this game turns into another 64x system required game, I swear I'm going to break a kneecap.#2: Animation Quality = I love the chopping down of trees and the maiming of overly maimed corpses, the arrow firing and ring-rung animations of swordsman swinging their swords in 4 different ways at least gives heart to this addition, I hate games like "Rome Total War" where there is literally 1-2 Animations for everything except pre-scripted cinema gestures. The only thing I noticed is the level attack animation, it looks like there is no attack speed pool between attacks as soon as the target engages within melee range. This might need a look into.#3: Map Movement Speed = I like this system, however I have seen it in many other F2P and B2P titles and some of which are much faster, this system prevents sieges from occuring too-often which is nice as players have to constantly run back and forth from their major city to replenish supplies and then run back, the only problem I see is when you are doing campaign or single player effects like quests, I think your movement speed should be increased for these and only these, especially if all your going to have to do is talk to some old fart.#4: Unit Composition = I love that you have brought back the obvious, Archer vs Swordsman vs Cavalry vs Pikeman vs Siege effect, but there is alot of balance to be had and as it is clearly obvious, Archers are the best. I also want my Trolls, what Orc army doesn't have a giant Cave Troll? Ogres are not as good as Trolls. I think if you were to add a Troll which you should, it should replace the useless Meat-Grinder and cost crowns to make.#5: Heros = Many games don't have a natural hero system, as it is very hard to balance, "IT IS" but either way, kudos to the Devs for adding it, however I would rather be given a choice on what type of hero I am interested in, it gripes me that  every Hero I've gotten so far has been melee, I would atleast like a "Switch Weapon" effect or be able to choose if my hero was a Mage, Archer, or Warrior, this would give the game more variation and would make buying Vanity for the individuals more effective as you would have more to choose from instead of 3 pathetic pieces of army that look the same.----FINISHED----Why I write reviews?-I write reviews to give developers and players a heads up and truthful perspective of what effects are taking place in the game in order to prevent the wrong crowd from joining a game they don't expect. I am a Balancer and Play-Tester of other games and have a huge tendancy to find bugs, or bugs find me and break the game entirely, or find things that are uncanny and imbalanced. I don't do these reviews for money or excerpts, I only post them as notifications, I have no interest is retaining any order within said game. Things need to be fixed, I post what and how in the review of the current stage. Simple constructive criticism.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Honestly i have been serching for a game like this for a very very long time.  This game gives everyone thee own estate and lordship in a fantasy mideval society.  In this estate you manage your troops your people and recorce income.  As you progress in the game you go from small town to massive fortress with many various maps to start your town on.  The combat is were the game truly shines however.  When you go to attack a enemy stronghold it takes alot fo preperation examineing eney fortifications trying to find the best point of attack.  And there is always the option to battle against players and npc settlements either solo or co op.  At the end of the battle there is nothing quite as satisfying as seeing your enemys walls fall to your armies.  The pvp element in this game encompases the majority of the game but if you are like me you can choose not to participate.  When you start you get a little featuer called battle protection this keeps other players from attacking your settlement.  This initial protection last 24 hours now at first you think 24 hours real time but no its 24 hours of game play in your current game and there is a in game option to extend that time.  So if you are like me and enjoy just playing the many quests you recive and building your settlement up you can do that without fear of getting attacked.  Another great thing is that if your protection is off and you are attacked you ca only be attacked wile you are logged in and then only if the attacking army is eaqually as powerful as yours so it is always a fair fight.  And should you choose to not fight you can pay the other player a tribute to keep from fighting.All in all this is probably the best mideval strategy game I have ever played.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
 A strategic and tactical middleage war game i find difficult to compare with other ones i played. Strategic, a bit of RPG, tactical, Business, Timeintensive, older graphic typeMostly i would make a compare with age of empires genre to build units and get them to action, but in difference it remembered me to such browsergames, because of the time you have to wait on your constructions till they are ready.Bulding a fortress with all things a middleage settlergame u imagine and take units out of three races and some special units like mighty dragons. Every Unit of every Race is for every player getable without paying money. As one of the old users (i bought the game times ago) i know there is such a massive progress in debugging and improving this game - nearly unbelieveable. This process isn´t still at its end and there are still some big points of loosing enthusiasm. But i have to admit, that there is a strange element in this game, that forces me to play again and again everytime for a while and to explore the hole game. Good for me: - Business system with some tricky elements to provide my progress, like peasant armys, Vassals producing ressources, - new progress poossibilities with all the buildings .. now it´s not still all researched after 3 days .. Thats very important for me. I want to have aims in game and there are still a few, that i didn´t reached all the time. Aims of Quests or Aims of my desire- mixing and combining armys in any comination.. Great, not one skilled army for all tasks- enough possibilies to get this crones, with which you can buy anything in addition to ressources (not pay to win)- great pve battles - army vs army or amry vs castle ..- great support by nice players all around- good quest system- the possibility to go many way to win.. every unit works fine on its wise. --> Not only one way to make a strong and functioning army Disadvantages of the game - Still since my starting its very slow in every discipline. Commands and orders have a standard delay of ca 1 sec--> this delay raises in pvp battles up to 4 sec. and graphic settings don´t change that. Because of that pvp isn´t still playable in my eyes- not answering gamesupport- not comprehensible effects of life reg on the different units.. a dragon with 50 life reg / s will not have over 10 life reg / real second. Knights instead can regenerate massive life - surely with their greater number of part-units- sometimes its dificult to find out the reason for missing the friend for an coop game. Since it is free to play i can recommend this game and minimum 10 hours that u will see a bit of the content This game is for you, if you like to get part by part stronger by saving up for mighty units and leveling all units and finding your own tactical way

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												The strum of a lute serenades my ears as my peasants dutiful mine on my homeland, carrying sacks of stone and gold, tending my fields, butchering livestock, and working hard in the forests surrounding my large keep with it's mighty stone walls. A babbling brook works through my stronghold as my men patrol the walls with crossbows, blunderbusses, and bows at the ready. Bubbling oil gurgles away at the top of my gatehouses waiting to pour onto those who'd dare breach the sancitity of my realm. Trebutchets sit atop round towers waiting for the drums of war. My quiet management of my fief is piereced by the panoply of trumpets hearlding a welp who dares to raze my homeland. So I herd my peasants in and lock the gatehouses. I assemble my personal guard to the outer courtyard and lock the inner gatehouse. The enemy arrives at the edge of my walls and my trebutchets begin to sing with the whistle of flying boulders and the "swipp" of arrows leaving their strings. My men bubble out from a far gatehouse and make battle with the enemy on the fields and ruins of my homeland's outfields. They are bloodied but are victorious, the enemy driven before them.  The gates open and the peasants return to their tasks. The lutes play again and the once again peace falls over my land. It feels good to be lord.Kingdom Wars is a PVE/PVP oriented MMORTS where you are lord of a tiny homestead on a vast and deeply detailed world of Mythador. Populated with Orcs, Elves, and Humans it reminds me deeply of Tolkien's Lord of the Rings but with a distinct Reverie Worlds spin. You can choose a race, two traits, and three different homelands that help give your kingdom a unique feel as well as mechanical benefits. You can engage in PVE quests or PVP content with additional Co-OP offerings. By far my favorite MMORTS to date and has hours upon hours of enjoyment.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2015
												If you've ever played an economy focused RTS like Age of Empires, built up a flourishing and efficient town over the course of a match, and then felt a twinge of sadness on the statistics screen at the loss of said town, then Kingdom Wars is a good bet. (Especially for the low low price of completely free.)Early game you'll spend most of your time optimizing your economy. Training more peasants, setting them to mine gold or stone, gather lumber or farm the fields, meanwhile using your small starting militia to complete the basic quests.After a day or two however that part of the game virtually disappears, with you making only a few adjustments now and then. The economy does everything it needs to, but not a lot more. The main meat of the game is BATTLE. :DPVP works like so:1: Put together an army that you built in your town, and bring it onto the world map.2: Click the "Search pvp" button and choose between attacking a city or fighting an army head on.3: If you're fighting an army you'll find yourself on a small open map with some mountains and a few camps of neutral forces.4: If you're in a siege the layout of the land can differ greatly depending on the homeland of the player. Siege weapons are required of course.5: Rewards for winning is gold that you loot of the bodies and Crowns just for winning.The actual combat is squad based, similar to Total War.You can switch between different formations to optimize various types of defence, movement speed and damage. Troops will level up as they participate in battle, allowing you to spend ability points to increase their stats.It's very worth bringing up the F2P platform, as many people shy away from games like this based on the fear of a Pay to Win barrier popping up in their way every time they were just starting to enjoy the game.Cutting to the chase, you don't ever need to spend money in this game. There is a currency called Crowns which you can gain through the following means:1: Winning any ingame fight - either against the AI or players2: Finishing quests3: Paying for it through microtransactionsThing is though, in the case of this game you don't really pay to gain an advantage as much as you do to skip large sections of the game. Sure, you can buy a ton of Crowns in the store and get loads of endgame units and be matched with the best players, but then you lose out on all of the Battles and Sieges that, assumedly, are the reason you are there in the first place.It is currently not possible to actually take control of AI castles, but this will be changed in an upcoming free expansion.PS: Don't pick the human female hero. The voice acting will drill it's way into your skull.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2015
												This is a giant timewaster of a game. If you ever played a facebook cow clicker game, this is basically the steam version of those. It's free, sure, but I still think I paid too much for it.It feels like I spent 95% of my time spent playing this doing nothing but waiting for enough resources to get the basic economy of my settlement going. I literally just sit and wait or play other games so that I can have enough resources to build a single building, and even that takes hours.  Then I logged out and when I came back later, the new building was just gone again, along with the resources. This game is a buggy mess, like so many reviewers have mentioned before. I had quests bug out, forcing me to restart the entire quest line because the dialogue happened in the main game screen, then the dialog scene began and there was no way to exit it again. I was even able to get the rewards for everything twice. Units fall through bridges before clipping back on to them correctly, sometimes the resource over time display just changes wildly for no real reason I can discern. I could forgive that, since the strategy genre is in a bit of a decline lately and options are scarce, if the rest of the game was fun.Well, do you enjoy watching a miniature model slowly walk across a huge map? Then you're in luck because that's what most of the game is like. The entire game is slow, slow, slow. Wait forever to get enough resources to build a handful of troops (which are pretty weak unless you upgrade the training facilities for currency, which also takes ages to gather enough of). Then spend even longer watching these units slowly trot across the map to a city or a quest location, where they will just get slaughtered.The worst offender however is combat. There is no control to it. You can't give orders to units because for some reason, while all units are trained in squads, you cannot issue attack commands to target specific squads. You just issue an attack move in the general direction of the enemy and hope your units don't die first. If there is a trick to it, the game doesn't tell you in the tutorial or in the time I spent playing it.And if your units aren't levelled to the maximum level, you might as well just zerg rush with all races because good luck keeping anyone alive. Units will ignore direct commands to disengage, frantically trying to rush back into the enemy army despite the squad being at 1|15 units with barely any health left. Your direct commands as player are just ignored by a batshit crazy AI that makes tactics or planning impossible. And to top it off, the animations of the units are ugly and repetative and the graphics look a good deal worse than Spellforce 1.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2015
												    Played about 10 hours.  This game has familiar things most rts games have.  When you start you choose between the 3 main races and and then choose between 3 start locations.  You then get an estate to start building up.  Its similar to stronghold series.  You  start to get some quest that introduce you to the game and let you start collecting some resources. Eventually it leads to you making an army and you go on from there.  I ended up getting to a part where i had to destroy 3 unrulely lords.  I wasn't very pleased with how the siege went.  It was buggy i needed to click many times and units sometime just do the oppostie of what you want.       For me it ended my time with the game.  I spent about 10 bucks on some cosmetic stuff.  Yes you only get 1 default option for everything.  You can then spend some money and buy limited choices.  For example you can pay a dollar to get one of the 5 choices of armor skins.  Or you can pay to decorate your heraldry.  Im ok with paying for some stuff, but don't break it all down into tiny micro transactions.  The game is free, and if you have little knowledge of these types of games i bet it can be a lot of fun.  For an rts vet some of the bugs are unforgivable for me.  I can still recommend it due to its freeness, and the fact that some real work was obviously put into it.  Just not enough for me.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												Kingdom wars is a MMORTS that boasts incredible F2P a great progression system and a massive variety of units. The game plays like a massive single player campaign through your own private instance of the world map. PvP and Co-op act like random encouters for your armies and villages. PvP can be easily avoided but rewards even the loser well. Co-op sieges with randoms or friends are good fun and expose you to more strategies.Currently the game features 3 playable races: Humans, Orcs and Elves. You choose 3 traits at the start to customise your races performance. Dwarves and Dragons are availiable as special units to all races. All races seem unique and quite balanced with the humans probably being the easiest to learn with.Your villages and armies cannot be attacked while you are offline and attacks can be avoided very easily with small amounts of gold or  battle protection when you are.If you ever liked any RTS game ever you should download and play this today. A really clever use of an online communitty for this genre. Hours and hours of fun for solo and social gamers alike.9/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												Kingdom Wars is  ideal if you like a game you don't want you running for 24/7.   It really doesn't pay to be logged in for the sake of it.  Also you don't become punished for your success as you don't have more than one city on a server to look after and build up.  The game is perfectly playable without paying, but if you do pay the game is not particuarly unbalanced for it.  There are loads of options to invest in research, whether for better catapaults, or better yield from your farms.  You will probably want more than one standing army, each tailored for various tasks and so you will need to generate gold to train the troops, though they will slowly train by winning battles.  It is more likely you will pay for their training as it is by far the quicker and economical option.   You will probably also need help fulfilling the battles that unfold as your story progresses which apart from chat is your only avenue of co-operative play with others.   You can make friends and ask them along which, if they have an army of similar strength, they have the option to do.   Added to this, attacking others happens on a random basis so far as army matches go. If you like, you can scour the area and maek battle with innate cities/armies.  People will attack you, and if you don't have the time, or don't want to take losses you can pay them off instead, rather than fight.  So I find when I need to off load goods that my industry is generating and recruit or train more troops, I log in every few hours.   If I want to battle I log in with expectation of taking maybe an hour - some sieges demand an element of patience - and If I just want to sort out my armies, again Iog in for a while as necessary.  So although many of the sieges are similar, they are not tedious, and since some players have been at this game for a year  or two, it is sustainable and so far as things go, I think I might be found here in this land in a few years time too.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Hello, Rhoken7 here.   I wanted to try and explore the game a little more before i tried to write a review for this game. I feel that it is a very well thought out game, I enjoy it. The battles are pretty epic in most points. The original sounding names of the places, the lore, the size of the game itself, and how you get to build your city the way you want, for the most part. I did the tutorial but i felt it lacking. I dont know if i missed a advanced stage or what, but some things you find out later in the game that you wish you knew at first. For instance, i wish i knew that my population cap didnt go over 90. I wouldn't have wasted my time trying to get it even higher and spend my earned recourses that i got in game on expanding building plots. the only positive out of doing so gives oyu the ability to increase your storage capacity. But i was a little let off when it told me that i could build more houses but when i got back to the game my population cap did not increase. Also i have knoticed that the PvP notifier is a little lacking as well. I dont spend all my time playing the game, once I finish what i can at that very moment. I may send an army out to a mission and i will go check something like youtube or Facebook. Which brings me to another point. Sometimes it can be very slow going. Which has caused some friends of mine to not give it a chance after one day. The times it takes to build, travel, or even gather enough recourses can take you days. (days of real time, not in game time). But back to PvP. There has been times I alt tab out of the game. or even while in game, im told there is someone at the gates for a fight, and nothing happens after that, the game will automatically "pay off" the person coming to my little town. I would much rather take my chances at fighting the person instead of the game automatically paying them off. Last thing i would like to point out is the graphics of the little characters running around. It can be horrid at times to see a horse that has no eyes. Just saying. The landscape graphics and buildings graphics are good for this game, I jus tthink the NPC's and other Characters in the game need a little bit of sprucing up. Other than those points i find this game to be very fun. I plan on playing it for a long time and would recommend it to anyone who likes something like Clash of Clans, C&C, or even Star Craft. It takes elements from a game like Clash of Clans where you build buildings and train units, upgrade those buildings, and go fight people. It takes a RTS point of view during battles and out of battle as well through out the game like Starcraft and C&C. If you like being a Commander of some sort of army and like to make a pretty cool little kingdom as well. this game is for you. Because of the bad character graphics, long wait times, and un-locatable PvP indicator at times, i give it a 7 out of 10. its a good game, just needs a little work.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												Alright, time to get a review on. I am here today to give a review to a game I don't think gets enough credit for what it does. Are you ready? Good! The game that we are going to dive into today is none other then Dawn of Fantasy Kingdom Wars. If you are not excited and you love strategy games you need to get excited because this game brings so much to the table. First off we have three different races to choose from humans, orcs, and elves, the later of which I am currently enjoying. These races are different in just enough ways to make you want to keep coming back for more. The humans may be versatile, where the orcs are tough and brutal and the elves are elegant. Don't fret there is no need to be careful on what race you pick you can have multiple armies and city's that you have built. I believe that having multiple armies is good for the game it keeps it fresh, I also like the looks on each races cities. Be careful here you can easily sink hours into the game just creating your city. This game is solid in all aspects of strategy, story, and mind numbing sieging for those of you who just want to get straight to the action. You also get heroic units that allow for fun, Mages, Minotaur, Dragons, and many other goodies. You can also customize your cities the more you put in the better your people will be protected! Now the game does have some bugs that can be frustrating. The game doesn't give you an option on whether or not you wish to participate in pvp all though it offers a buy out for the siege it does get frustrating when you are in the middle of building and you get attacked. I have listed the Pros and the Cons of this game but in all honestly you need to pick the game up its free on steam and decide for you self whether this is a go or a dump. This game does allow you to bring friends along on a siege so dust off your armor and lets get ready to go to war!  If I was to rate this game I would give it a solid 7.5 out of 10 the game has to much replay value and is definitely a trend setter in the strategy game department.

I believe that having multiple armies is good for the game it keeps it fresh, I also like the looks on each races cities. Be careful here you can easily sink hours into the game just creating your city. This game is solid in all aspects of strategy, story, and mind numbing sieging for those of you who just want to get straight to the action. You also get heroic units that allow for fun, Mages, Minotaur, Dragons, and many other goodies. You can also customize your cities the more you put in the better your people will be protected! Now the game does have some bugs that can be frustrating. The game doesn't give you an option on whether or not you wish to participate in pvp all though it offers a buy out for the siege it does get frustrating when you are in the middle of building and you get attacked. I have listed the Pros and the Cons of this game but in all honestly you need to pick the game up its free on steam and decide for you self whether this is a go or a dump. This game does allow you to bring friends along on a siege so dust off your armor and lets get ready to go to war!  If I was to rate this game I would give it a solid 7.5 out of 10 the game has to much replay value and is definitely a trend setter in the strategy game department.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2015
												This game kind of sucks, it has so much potential but it just falls short. The gameplay/combat resembles the lord of the rings strategy game but with a million years more waiting and "crowns" which you slowly generate through battles or you can just go pay to win and purchase them with real money, the coop is kind of pathetic with only certain missions being able to be cooped and you have to have similar armies and be in same region so if you want to be different races you will have to do lots of walking and waiting to coop, you cant see other players only your own city so the whole world map seemed pointless to me. The game is pretty laggy in pvp and coop, i know the company has been trying hard to reduce it but i bought this game back when it was first released as dawn of fantasy a few years ago and it has yet to be improved. This game doesnt have to many hackers but there are a few who ive had the displeasure of battling. This game is very slow if they got rid of the crowns it would be better but i guess they have to earn money since this game failed when it wasnt free to play. Graphics are pretty good in this game but there are a few bugs such as walls not touching ends of cliffs properly so when people attack you they can just walk between the gap rather than haveing to actually attack the walls or gate and units sometimes have issues staying in groups when you put them on the walls or towers not to mention they sometimes dont shoot inside of the base from the outside walls when units swarm in. Overall this game does lack quite alot but if you want to win pvp just buy a whole lot of crown units they will overpower the average units in any battle even if you are completely outnumber crown units will be able to get you an easy win, they definatly do need nerfed but as long as people keep spending real money to get them im sure they will stick around for a while. definatly do not play this if you are looking for a good coop game, this sucks and should just be considered a mmo at best. Game had so much potential am kind of disappointed but am looking forward to the new game they are making and hopefully they will fix all the issues with that one which they never did in this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												Not sure how my last review was deleted but I'll post again. :o) This is a pretty good game but you have to be aware of a couple things. First and foremost, the developer has shifted focus to their next game, "Kingdom Wars 2: Battles" so you jumping on a ship everyone is getting off of. Secondly, this developer has in the past done complete wipes IN RELEASE state! That was when I quit.As for the game itself, it is definitely worth a play but realize you can't really play with friends like you would think for a multi-player game. The process is very convoluted, and buggy from my experience. The part that stands out is your ability to have a persistent home city you can come back to to get resources and defend from invaders. Which brings me to my next point, you can be attacked any time including while you are away. If the AI didn't suck that might be fine lol.If you are looking for something free and entertaining by all means give it a go but go into it with the above expectations and understanding. All in all, I can't recommend this game when there are better ones out there.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												Given the different behavior of the game at each connection, one wonders if the preferred method of the developers is not to copy and paste entire sections of code without really knowing what they are doing !!! A strategy game where nothing is predictable !!! * Units lose health or disappear without reasons. * The walls and buildings deteriorate without reason * In your inventory, resources disappear or fluctuate without reasons -   There may be expenses for maintenance of the city, but not equivalent to a life cycle of a mine stone,  in just 30MN.* Mines are recovering at different speeds (from a connection session to another)* In PVP, friends or enemy units may have the same colors (a stupid choice)* More, the NPC and players can have the same color !!* Use the mouse to select  something is arduousBecause the automatic reset not working on the forum, I asked the  KW support. Here is their amazing response : "we will reset your forum password, and contact you in a day or two". Many players animate and participate in forums games,  so they have an idea of how they work. It should not take more than five minutes to change the information in the user management interface. 2 days and 4 even if I consider the date of my first email is not credible.Do you have had problems with your mouse or the keyboard keys since the installation of the game? Valve should have some security requirements : Valve responsibility can be clearly commit if it turns out they distribute rogue software on their plate-form. Online games may have  become a method of money  laundering for all  maffias of the world. Valve tell us if you contribute to that !!!

												Sorry I just can't write a good review for this game. Kingdom Wars could be a great game, BUT, The devs refuse to part with wizards that can wipe out whope amies with one spell. Until the devs get rid of the wizards OR make the wizards only able to cover a very small area instead of 1/4 of the screen with their spells. this is NOT a fun game to play.  Wizards were always more of a healer than a battle unit, and even as a battle unit they are only able to attack one unit at a time, NOT half a battle field. No Wizard, even Morgana or Merlin ever had that much accumulated manna stored up to cast that kind of magic and had to reserve their mana and use it in small amounts as if you deplete your mana, you have a good chance of dying, unable to defend yourself from other on the battle field or even from disease. The wizards in this game do not even have to use their mana to keep a field around themselve to stop or deflect damage, but instead are just higher in kill points and life points as you level them up. I founf NO limit to how high you can level a wizard up. UNTIL they get rid of or change wizards to conform within reality like the other troops in this game I will recommend that no one purchase this game.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												The game is awesome and really hits the spot when it comes to solid RTS mechanics.Bugriddled but confident enough to sell ingame currency. I didn't pay for anything but I don't understand how the developers would expect anyone to. That being said, the game is anything but pay to win and it's not very difficult to get crowns (the currency you can purchase). Everything about the game is conceptually well designed and executed, playing can be alot of fun if it weren't for some issues.If you enjoy constant crashes and losing hours/days of progress and frustration is your cup of tea, then you absolutely must download this game. Armies stuck on Mountains, Special units bugging out your whole army and forcing you to disband them completely, user interface glitches, connection errors, desync in pvp, general unresponsiveness of units to the point of ignoring your commands completely, pathfinding issues.. I could go on and on. It's a waste of time if every aspect of the game is filled with frustation. The game has crashed more often than I've been able to exit properly.The developers offer support in the form of reimbursement of losses if you contact them per e-mail, but I honestly would have to write one every day, that's just not the kind of game I want to play. I couldn't begin to count the amount of posts I've read from devs saying they would or had fixed the exact problems I'm running into. They either don't have the time, because of their newest release, are incapable, or uninterested in fixing the issues. That seems dishonest to me.I'm kind of angry, so you might still want to check out the game regardless of what I've written.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												I could sit here and tell you it's a great game, and it's worth the money, and you are missing out if any one says otherwise...As a veteran of this game I can truly say out of many RTS games that go from online to single player. That Kingdom Wars has been the only game to catch my interest in years.There is much to do, and yet so much to acomplish. The land is full of ripe adventure you just need to discover it.                                                     This can be some what of a spoiler, but proves my point.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I favor the orcish hordes. With being a Warleader of Orcs who will call you Grr Mada meaning great warrior in orcish. I can tell you that every race has a great and mostly unique way of making you feel like a powerful ruler, if not peaceful savior. The orcs take what they can get rather it be meat from an animal, ogre, or human alike. The elves protect their lands from taint, and brutality. They respect their land and give back. The humans prove their worth with noble tasks. Either by protecting the weak, or just simply fighting with inspiration courage.

number of helpful: 24 of 50 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												Buy this game!If you are a fan of RTS games, as well as a fan of games that allow you to continue an online progression over a long period of time, this is the game for you!  Build up a city:  3 different ways of doing this based on your raceUpgrade that city:  No cosmetic upgrades but the buildings will perform better as you put more resources in to themBuild an Army:  3 distinct ways of doing this, with the ability to hire units from other racesSIEGE a city:  Like never before in a game, tear down a cities defenses brick by brick and funnel your forces in to storm their castle, fly powerful dragons over the walls while your siege weapons lay waste and make your opponent tremble in PVP or PVE battlesDefend YOUR city:  PvP from within the safetey of your city, watch as armies smash like water dropplets off your mighty walls as your archers rain fiery arrows down own their undefended heads, setting the ground around them ablaze forcing them to scatter!)Send Trade Caravans:  Build a city that generates more resources than you ever need?  Send caravans to every corner of the world and make allies to trade with so that you can recruit and train units, or just to earn extra gold for your goods to spend on upgrading your units or for crowns to buy powerful dragons/elite units/ Dwarven helpers and more!Everything you could possibly want in an RTS has been crammed into this title.  It IS being done by an indy company so game updates come a bit slow compared to some other games, but it does not ask you to keep paying around every corner to be able to enjoy your purchase as so many games with cash shops do. ***CASH SHOP CLARIFICATION*** You should really read this.This game has 'Crowns'.  Crowns are earned through questing, completing achievements, through pvp, you can buy them with gold, they can be given to you by your guild treasurer, for refering a friend or yes, you CAN purchase them.   I have owned this game for 1 month and I have 700 crowns and NO need to spend them on anything ever again and I've only spent the initial purchase price for this game.  THIS GAME IS NOT PAY TO WIN.  I have never paid a dime past the purchase price and I currently own 8 level 40 dragons and 6 elite units ALL earned from questing/pvpThis is the definition of pay-to-save-time.  Everyone is on an even playingfield here.  The cash shop is ONLY there as an option to provide extra support to the project while allowing yourself to get these units/walls/upgrades without putting in the minimal effort needed to otherwise do so.Some of the Cons:  (Sorry indie game, all games got em and nobody is paying me to say otherwise :p)Graphics:  Dated, to say the least.  While the assets on the map and the cities look great, the up close graphics of the units are OLD.  They look like Dungeon siege 2 units.   That said, just look at the screenshots, what are you doing so zoomed in to be staring at one unit for ANYWAY?   Well, cause a good portion of the game is talking and you are forced to see this.  Otherwise you'd never really notice it.Pathfinding:  This is currently not great.  You tell units to go to a place and most of them will fairly quickly after, but it definitely leaves a lot to be desired.  That said, the free expansion coming out this month is called the 'Arcana and Pathfinding' update.  So yeah.Glitches:  Every game has it's issues... this one has troubles with finding coop groups if you have attack protection on, units will get stuck in places they shouldn't be allowed to even go, you might have an instance where a resource vanishes after pvping.   That said, the staff is very quick and courteous to get back to you.  It might take a couple days to line everything up, but they are great at communication as long as you use the proper channels.No you?! Currently the games biggest flaw... Where are you?   We need more players to join in the fun!

content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												The issue is that Dawn of Fantasy is not a good MMORTS. For most computers you are going to be playing on low and still experience mind numbing lag from the tiniest seige battles at the beggining of the game. Resource gathering has nothing to it, nor do things like skill. Tech tree is tiny, you will have built everything by hour three and thus has every unit for your faction. Then lets go to the combat. Every unit you create at home has a level up system, which much be activated manually for each of the 30-40 units you feild. Thats right, before every battle you have to individually level up every single unit. I was playing orcs, and this got boring by the time I had a screen full of goblins. Kingdom wars is not a good game, and Reverie is under the impression if they keep adding tiny packs of content to the game it's suddenly going to fix every problem in their games code; or better yet suddenly turn their game into a strategy title. You won't experience multiplayer, nobody plays.

content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												Such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ free game to be honest, I've played other free games on here and Ive never been so disgusted by this game. Poor unit support, poor unit placement support, poor unit feedback support the game is just so shtty overall. I dont mind paying a buck or two or even $10 for a game that actually works MOST of the time rather than half the time. This game isn't really "free" and they say it isn't pay to win but that isn't really the case. This game in fact is CLEARLY A PAY 2 WIN because you can buy the ingame currency(crowns) for cash and enhance your army/city way faster than a freebie player would. Honestly don't play this game, this is coming from an avid RTS gamer and sadly there aren't many great free RTS games here on steam. Full of bugs too, it's really annoying. KW 2 is coming out so the devs won't have time to fix this sht. So if you actually waste time and money on this game I feel sorry for you. Do yourself a favour and save some valuable time and money. Don't play this horse sht.

												Has good support&mods to assist you.But still lacks from plenty things, the most terrible is the matchmaking on PvP: I fought one with my troops around 30 units with level 5 against a guy around 50 unit troops with level 20. He wipe out me from the map obviously.Play on single player, avoid PvP. And as you may though, for playing alone there are better games on Steam than this.

number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												You have to pay money to unlock core aspects of the game, including the actual Campaign and Skirmish modes. Now, I have no problem with DLC, or even microtransactions, as long as you're getting something ADDITIONAL to an otherwise well-featured game. But this is just penny-pinching here. They've clearly stripped several aspects of the game away, and then forced you to pay to unlock core features.This is basically the PC equivalent of "on-disc DLC."

number of helpful: 5 of 12 people (42%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												Such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ free game to be honest, I've played other free games on here and Ive never been so disgusted by this game. Poor unit support, poor unit placement support, poor unit feedback support the game is just so shtty overall. I dont mind paying a buck or two or even $10 for a game that actually works MOST of the time rather than half the time. This game isn't really "free" and they say it isn't pay to win but that isn't really the case. This game in fact is CLEARLY A PAY 2 WIN because you can buy the ingame currency(crowns) for cash and enhance your army/city way faster than a freebie player would. Honestly don't play this game, this is coming from an avid RTS gamer and sadly there aren't many great free RTS games here on steam. Full of bugs too, it's really annoying. KW 2 is coming out so the devs won't have time to fix this sht. So if you actually waste time and money on this game I feel sorry for you. Do yourself a favour and save some valuable time and money. Don't play this horse sht.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 17, 2013
												Well....i like town building - war mongering games. From basic ones like Travian, to complex ones like Dawn of Fantasy , Clash of Clans and else.Dawn of Fantasy is a good game, but i am skeptical to say its worthwhile.three points kill this game : First : Combat is stupid and bad...its frustrating to play, units are dumb, combat is slow, you need no strategy most of times...its plain, dull and boring.2- Pay2Win, crowns when i first saw them and got them from missions made me happy, then i realized that most things need crowns and even if you keep repeating boring missions or pvp you will never have enough.3-Low building diversity, your castle is pretty, you have like 20 slots to build in each area..and  like 8 buildings...its odd, seems like its a broken system, i cant explain.So...if you compare the gameplay of travian or clash of clans, this game is horrible....its just has some cool graphics, pretty town and world map....overall i would give a ...well, sorry a 4 of 10.

Plus, the early entry is a bit boring. Maybe the game develops as you move along, but the early stages just couldn't engage me.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												Original: if you liked midieval/fantasy, and or love RTS games, this is for you. the work and difficulty of just putting up a wooden wall is tremendous, making it all the more glorious. 9/10 would reccomendEdit: I have to say i can no longer reccommend this game. it was fun, but then a tragedy occured... a tragedy i like to call... "The Great Nerfing". It started out like any other day, i hopped on and logged into my kingdom "Hitlers work camps", to notice work camps had been nerfed... later i found out that you could no longer sell units for money as in slaves and workers, then i found that crowns had been made even more rare, the one currency that makes this online world go round, all in the space of 3 days. i present to you, the GOTY, nerfsville. The devs should fix the bugs and rework the game before they start nerfing all of our tactics. Oh! i forgot to mention, all the large towns and villages you see on the title screen? they aren't player created. those are npc towns that they will most likely make you fight and destroy if you want to progress in the game. yep! your gonna fight that large wall with archers and catapults lining its top, with a little less then a catapult or two and some knights. good luck and dont win.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2015
												I really want to like this game.Great pvp setupCo-op Sieges are the bees kneesdoes NOT feel like a 'pay-to-win'I found the base-building enjoyableBalanced tech tree / costsI have just ran into too many issues that leave me more frustrated than satisfied. Formations don't saveStandground doesn't always make units stand ground.I can't assign troops to Ctrl+[7-9]units stack infinitelyunbalanced unitsSo I end up loving the game until battles start getting intense and it becomes an uphill fight just to manage the army from running off after one unbalanced unit as it just casually walks past all my frontline to archers/siege-equipment. Feels pointless to worry about actual tactics the way the units can stack (just put tanks on top of pikes on top of healers on top of dps etc). Also found that reinforcements on a 'very-easy' level to be equal in challenge to a 'hard' level so that was also very off-putting. I can't expect this game's mechanics to play fair and thus cannot reccomend this to the public.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												Played this game a while ago because it promised a lot of things... and it didn't deliver on those promises.  I could sit here and type out a really long review, but I'm just not motivated to do so.  The game was just so uninteresting and just so time-consuming that I hated it.  The pay-to-win design takes away any sense of accomplishment and ruins the competitive nature of the strategy component.  What's worse is that the game tries to be an MMOG in all the wrong ways.  The expansions make no sense at all and should really just be considered game updates instead, but the devs behind this game do not seem to have common sense.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												This game could be good.. it COULD be, instead it highly sucks for few reasons:1. There is no unit collision, you don't understand anything in battles and you can't even defend walls cause there's no unit collision, we're in 2014 ffs.2. Graphics really sucks. I am not a guy who looks at graphics, but in this game you can't even set the resolution, there's no antialiasing, shadows keep moving, models and textures are fine instead.3. You can't place buildings/walls where you want, there are "pre-made places" where you can choose what to build, and in an "RTS" this sucks really hard.4. MOST IMPORTANT... You have to wait DAYS to get some resources, and yes REAL DAYS. Look, I just went to fight the army of a bot cause of a quest, my men all died, and to make the army again I should wait real days. If you get like 25 units of paesants to cut wood at the same time, in an entire day it will give you 5000 wood more or less, and you spend it all in 10 seconds. Same for food and gold. Making the army requires food and gold, and it's really really really slow.5. Formations... I would like to "customize" more the formations of the units, like in a Total War game, I really don't like it how it is now.. and by the way, without collisions and stuff, battles are just a massive charge and the more outnumbered wins...I won't play this game anymore untill the developers improve these points, I had literally no fun playing this game, I don't want to wait days to get some resources, and I really don't like those other bad points I listed.This game could have potential, I hope the devs start fixing at least these 5 points.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Not pay to win, but it is pay to play. To research almost anything you need Crowns, Wealth, or Influence, synonyms for Premium Currency. You gain this by doing quests, but you gain 1-2 per quest. You can gain them through PVP or PVE, but you get 1-2 per quest. To build walls around your town you need 32 Crowns. Increasing worker speed? 8 Crowns. It's not worth the grinding, and the grinding is required. I'd rather they just stick a price-tag on it and let me build my walls in peace.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												The game sounds intriguing and when you first start it's kind of "cool". Very very mind numblingly slow RTS after the first 3 or 4 hours. Resources are gathered by the minute, which is ok when you're just starting out and it's .1 of anything. The starting quests get you built up fairly quickly, but the regular game play does not transition well. Kind of like giving a kid a bunch of money and expecting him to be able to budget properly later.AI is very simple, and there are some core things missing from this to really call it a "strategy" game.pros:Set it and forget it farming (offline resource gathering)Each unit is actually a squad.Semi-persistent worldYou don't notice when units die because there's a pile of corpses everywhere and the victor can make get some loot. (you were the victor right?)Problems:No attack queueing (can't tell units to attack more than one target)Units who are told to attack, move to the target units position and will run right passed the oncoming hoard to reach their "destination" which usually ends as being a corpse.Unit control is next to non existent, often with some sort of resource allocation group there's a couple of government workers just standing around.No real strategy to speak of, unit placements and formations are abominable at bestHuge collision problems, with units and other items. (elf hero can run through great trees but gets stuck in a berry bush...)Unit designation (alt+#) does not persist when you go from world map to local map (even if units never left the field)Seemingly random unit selection as commander when selecting large amounts of units instead of the hero.There's no real benefit to having a hero. They are squishy, always the target, and often gets lost on the fieldThere's no hotkeys to speak of for unit skills, have to select each unit type at a time to make use of what skills are available anyway
